##Showing the data

```{r}
post_meal_data

glimpse(post_meal_data)
```


## Plot one continous variabel

```{r}
#| fig-cap: "Distribution of BMI"
#| label: fig-bmi-histo
ggplot(post_meal_data, aes(x = BMI)) +
  geom_histogram()
```

See @fig-bmi-histo

## Exercise: discrete plots
```{r}
#| fig-cap: "Glykemi"
#| label: fig-Glykemi
ggplot(post_meal_data, aes(x = glykemi)) +
  geom_bar()
```

See @fig-Glykemi above for a cool plot!

## Plotting two discrete variables 

```{r}
ggplot(post_meal_data, aes(x = Group, fill = as.character(glykemi))) +
  geom_bar(position = position_dodge())
```

## Side by side plots

```{r fig-BMI-glycemia}
#| fig-cap: "BMI and Glycemia, side by side"
#| fig-subcap:
#|  - "Distribution of BMI."
#|  - "Number of those with Glycemia"
#| layout-ncol: 2
ggplot(post_meal_data, aes(x = BMI)) +
  geom_histogram()
ggplot(post_meal_data, aes(x = glykemi)) +
  geom_bar()
```
## PLotting two continuous variables 

```{r}
#| fig-cap: "Scatter plot of BMI and the area under the curve for glucose"
#| label: fig-bmi-auc-pg
ggplot(post_meal_data, aes(x = BMI, y = auc_pg)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth()
```
